page.title: 04SCHOOLAID SHILLINGSTONE
page.content: In January 1980 a Public Meeting was held in the Portman Hall Shillingstone It was decided,on the instigation of the Headmistress,Governors and PTA ,to set up a fundraising committee to finance major improvements to the school.Not only the school benefitted from the numerous fundraising activities which followed.The community spirit generated led to a remarkable giving of time,energy and cooperation as well as money.In 4 years this small village with a school of less than 50 pupils raised over Â£7000 and purchased a new classroom for the Infants,freeing the original 1855 schoolroom for use as a Hall/Gym.Since then the committee has raised a further Â£4000 to equip the Gym.The PTA raise generous funds also.
